Metadata: Adociasulfates 1-6, inhibitors of kinesin motor proteins from the sponge "Haliclona" (aka "Adocia") sp

Adociasulfates 1-6 were isolated from an extract of the Palauan sponge "Haliclona" (aka "Adocia") sp. that inhibited the transport of stabilized microtubules by the motor protein kinesin. Kinesins comprise a superfamily of eukaryotic motor proteins used to transport a large variety of cargoes along microtubule tracks. They are important targets for inhibition because they are involved in many dynamic microtuble- mediated events, including cell division and the transport of vesicles and organelles.
